Question 75) Electric shower is a device capable of turning electricity into thermal energy, which enables water temperature to increase. A shower designed to work at 110 V can be adapted to function at 220 V to keep its power unchanged.
One way to do this adaptation is to exchange the resistance of the shower for another, of the same material and with the
A) double the length of the wire.
B) half the length of the wire.
C) half of the straight section area of ​​the wire.
D) quadruple of the area of ​​the straight section of the wire.
E) Fourth part of the straight section area of ​​the wire.
